post_text:
Join WLOS ABC 13 and Charles T. Koontz Intermediate School teacher Ms. DeLana Parker and learn how this veteran teacher is working to make her classroom comfortable for students, both during Remote Learning and beyond!

As reported by WLOS:
A Buncombe County teacher is planning something special for her students when they return to in-school learning.

"Even in the best of times, sixth grade is a tough age. And it's tough to come in and socially collaborate on things. So, I thought having this coming in and having this commonality of a mascot will help them transition easier and also give them some positivity," Parker said.

Also, see our story and photos: https://www.facebook.com/BuncombeSchools/posts/3558819884130214

#WeAreBCS #BCS #BCSadvantage #Asheville #AVL #Buncombe #828isgreat #NCpublicschools #RamFam #GoRams #WeAreTCR #BCSreturntolearn #BackToSchool

post_text: The award-winning Buncombe County Schools Nutrition Department has partnered with local farms to bring fresh food to our students! Visit ReturnToLearn.BuncombeSchools.org for information on curbside meal pickup during our Plan B - Beyond remote learning period.
shared_text:
Buncombe County Schools Nutrition
September 9 at 3:59 PM ¬∑

Hey BCS family, check out these delicious Parmesan crusted tomatoes. Don't they look so good!?

We hope you all had a chance to come by one of our curbside meal service sites last week for some free tomatoes!

In case you missed them, here is a great recipe we shared for you to try at home with your family!
These juicy tomatoes with a crunchy topping are sure to hit the spot for everyone in the family.

Big shout ASAP - Appalachian Sustainable Agriculture Projectt, BNH enterprises and Beacon Village farms for helping us bring these fresh locally grown tomatoes to your kitchen!

üåç How will your art change the world? This is among the questions that seven #BCSGrads answer in this inspiring video from the Wortham Center for the Performing Arts. As we announced several weeks ago, the following students all received the Y.E.S. Emerging Artists Fund scholarship that will assist them as they pursue a career in the #arts.

‚Ä¢ Anaiya Adwaters (voice/musical theatre) - T.C. Roberson High School Graduate
‚Ä¢ Linda Diaz-Aguilar (voice/guitar) - Enka High School Graduate
‚Ä¢ Chayse Howard (tuba) - A.C. Reynolds High School Graduate
‚Ä¢ Katherine Stevens (voice/musical theatre) - T.C. Roberson High Graduate
‚Ä¢ Julien Swoap (saxophone/theatre) - Martin L. Nesbitt, Jr. Discovery Academy Graduate
‚Ä¢ Shelby Taylor (clarinet) - Enka High School Graduate
‚Ä¢ Aaron White (trumpet) - T.C. Roberson High Graduate

We can't wait to see how these young artists make a difference through their unique artistic talent!

post_text:
#BCSGrads: You might see a familiar face the next time you watch an #NFL football game. As reported by the Asheville Citizen Times, #Rockets standout football player Rico Dowdle has been drafted by the Dallas Cowboys!üèà

"The former Reynolds High School and South Carolina standout made the 53-man roster cut for the Dallas Cowboys over the weekend, earning one of three running back spots on the team. Dowdle, an undrafted rookie, is the third running back option on the Cowboys' roster behind Ezekiel Elliot and Tony Pollard."

"Dowdle was signed by the Dallas Cowboys as an undrafted free agent April 25."

"As a standout at Reynolds, Dowdle, the 2015 All-WNC Player of the Year, carried the ball 247 times for an area-best 2,545 yards and 51 touchdowns his senior year. He passed for 1,434 yards and 11 touchdowns with four interceptions and had a 55-yard touchdown reception."

Read the full story below! ‚¨áÔ∏è

#rocketcountry #rpi #rocketprideinside #bcs #wearebcs #bcsadvantage #asheville #athletics #publicschoolproud #ncpublicschools #goals

Local fans of the top Netflix show 'Cobra Kai' (a present day 'Karate Kid' story) will recognize at least one character on screen! Hannah Kepple, a #BCSgrad and A.C. Reynolds High School musical theatre alumna plays the high school sidekick "Moon!" Hannah is known in the Asheville area for her prowess on stage with the Rockets, Asheville Community Theatre, and the Flat Rock Playhouse.

According to the Asheville Citizen Times, Kepple said, "Everyone was so kind and helped me navigate my way on the set, and it's been such a great experience. And since I know that the cast and crew is so kind and talented. it just makes the show‚Äôs success better.‚Äù

Safety starts the moment that students, staff, or visitors arrive to a Buncombe County school. üöó üöåAs we continue this unique school year, a health screening is required for every person on campus.

Screenings include a temperature check and health assessment questions, followed by use of üß¥ hand sanitizer. Learn more about our health screening process for car riders, student drivers, bus riders, and front entrance visitors in our latest 'Safety Series' video narrated by Asst. Supt. Joseph T. Hough.

View our full Return to Learn 'Safety Series' in our video library: https://www.buncombeschools.org/cms/One.aspx?portalId=92531&pageId=3747858

(Produced by BCS Communications.)

post_text:
Congratulations to North Buncombe High School's Karlyn Pickens!

As reported by the Asheville Citizen Times: One of the top softball players in the country and reigning Western Mountain Athletic Conference player of the year has committed to a SEC program.

North Buncombe junior Karlyn Pickens announced her commitment to the University of Tennessee Sept. 2 over eight other Division I offers.

As a freshman, Pickens batted .492 with seven home runs, 25 RBI, three doubles and four triples for North Buncombe. She was named the Western Mountain Athletic Conference player of the year and was also an accomplished pitcher with two wins, five saves and a 1.07 ERA with 82 strikeouts.

‚¨áÔ∏è‚¨áÔ∏è‚¨áÔ∏èRead more in the story below!

post_text:
Sand Hill-Venable Elementary School came up with a creative way to get their staff photo this year! Principal Tyla Moody invited Charles D. Owen High School Drone Technologies teacher Craig Orange to take photos from the air on Aug. 26. The weather cooperated, and everyone had fun while staying physically distant, Ms. Moody said.

Buncombe County Schools CTE has added three Drone Technologies teachers this year at the high school level for a total of five. Students who take their #innovative courses learn how drones work, how to interpret data received from different drone-based instruments, photography, videography, and the expanding career opportunities for drone pilots. They can even earn a Part 107 Drone License from the Federal Aviation Administration.

#BCS #CTE #wearebcs #bcsadvantage #ncpublicschools #publicschoolproud #teachergoals #asheville

post_text:
üß¨üî¨üîéThe Kindergarten teaching team at Fairview Elementary School has the solution to making science fun. According to Caitlin Sullivan, this week the students began their virtual lesson by sharing what they think a scientist does.

"We will share read alouds throughout the week to teach them what science is, what tools scientists use, and most importantly, that ANYONE can be a scientist," she said.

Ms. Sullivan and her fellow teachers thought it would be fun to dress up as mad scientists to capture the students' attention.

"We wanted them to see how much fun we can still have even though we are not in the classroom together," she added.

Remote learning for all students in grades K-12 runs through September 25. If you are having technical issues or have questions about assignments, don't hesitate to reach out directly to your teacher or principal.

#Rockets #RPI #RocketCountry #BCSReturnToLearn #BCSstrong #bcs #wearebcs #bcsadvantage #ncpublicschools #publicschoolproud #teachergoals #asheville #BCready #buncombeready #avlstrong

post_text:
According to a press release from the U.S. Department of Agriculture, Buncombe County Schools (BCS) and school systems nationwide will be able to extend the free summer meals program through December 31, 2020. This crucial waiver will help ensure that all children in our community continue to have access to nutritious food as we navigate back-to-school plans during a pandemic.

‚ÄúWe are so excited to hear this news,‚Äù said Buncombe County Schools Nutrition Director Lisa Payne. ‚ÄúOur cafeteria staff has worked tirelessly since March 16 to provide nutritious meals to children at no cost. I always say a well-fed child is a child that‚Äôs ready and able to learn. We have served well over 1 million meals since this public health crisis began, and we are ready and willing to serve 1 million more to help students thrive during this uncertain time.‚Äù

ü•Ñ Free/Reduced Cost Meal Application information for Fall, 2020:
https://www.buncombeschools.org/cms/One.aspx?portalId=92531&pageId=253029

shared_text:
BUNCOMBESCHOOLS.ORG
USDA Extends Free Meals for Kids through Dec. 31
text:
According to a press release from the U.S. Department of Agriculture, Buncombe County Schools (BCS) and school systems nationwide will be able to extend the free summer meals program through December 31, 2020. This crucial waiver will help ensure that all children in our community continue to have access to nutritious food as we navigate back-to-school plans during a pandemic.

‚ÄúWe are so excited to hear this news,‚Äù said Buncombe County Schools Nutrition Director Lisa Payne. ‚ÄúOur cafeteria staff has worked tirelessly since March 16 to provide nutritious meals to children at no cost. I always say a well-fed child is a child that‚Äôs ready and able to learn. We have served well over 1 million meals since this public health crisis began, and we are ready and willing to serve 1 million more to help students thrive during this uncertain time.‚Äù

ü•Ñ Free/Reduced Cost Meal Application information for Fall, 2020:
https://www.buncombeschools.org/cms/One.aspx?portalId=92531&pageId=253029

#BCSreturntolearn #BCS #WeAreBCS #BCSadvantage #Asheville #Buncombe #WNC #NCpublicschools #828isgreat

High schoolers joined other Buncombe County students in Remote Learning last Friday, as they wrapped up the second week of onboarding at reduced student capacity. Students spent the week safely diving into new topics and labs, exploring their outdoor campuses, meeting new teachers, reconnecting with friends, and preparing to collaborate remotely through Sept. 25. It may be a unique season, but we're looking forward to another successful school year!

post_text:
Virginia Ward of Fairview and the Martin L. Nesbitt, Jr. Discovery Academy was chosen from among ~279,000 volunteers at 419 National Parks for a National Park Service award!

According to the Asheville Citizen Times, Ward "has won the prestigious 2019 Youth Award as part of the George and Helen Hartzog Awards for Outstanding Volunteer Service, an annual recognition of volunteer excellence in the National Park Service."

‚ÄúSo, since I was young, I've just always loved plants, I've always loved the parkway, and interning and volunteering with [ecologist Dr. Chris Ulrey] has been a great way to put those two things together,‚Äù Virginia Ward said.

post_text:
As we continue Remote Learning through Sept. 25, students and families are encouraged to discuss any concerns or questions that arise with their teachers and school administrators. We're here to help!

Our Technology Help desk is also available to support you during this time and now features a convenient Live Chat option. Visit ReturnToLearn.BuncombeSchools.org for hours and details.

As reported by WLOS ABC 13:
The district is following what officials call Plan B Beyond. The first two weeks of school was more of an on-boarding for students, teachers and staff. Students got to report in person a few days to meet their teachers and classmates and then get adjusted at home online the other days.

So far, things have gone smoothly, school leaders said. And they hope that continues for the next four weeks as the district switches to full remote.

post_text:
#BCSreturntolearn: At T.C. Roberson High School on Thursday, the üêè Rams concluded their second week of onboarding and now transition to Remote Learning through Sept. 25. During onboarding, students attended on alternating days in significantly reduced numbers to prepare for the new school year. They wasted no time getting into their new subject matters, forming groups for hands-on labs, and making use of their outdoor spaces.

For the safety of all, students and staff practiced physical distancing, washed hands frequently, and wore face coverings (with short "mask breaks" possible during the day, such as during distanced outdoor lunch times).

Community High School students finished their second onboarding week on Thursday. They've been getting to know their teachers and preparing for the all-remote learning period.

Known for small class sizes, rich community partnerships, and flexible yet rigorous instruction, Community High supports students‚Äô needs and prepares them for both academic and personal success.

"It has been exciting to have students back in the building ‚Äî we have missed them!" said Principal Janet Greenhoe. "We've started the new school year differently, but different is what the staff at Community High does best! Community High teachers and staff are working diligently every day to ensure our students have a great school year!"

#BCSreturntolearn: The Blackhawks of North Buncombe High School kicked off the unique school year by making the most of their in-person onboarding days. From anatomy and English to JROTC and welding, students met their new teachers, dove into new topics, and prepared for Remote Learning until Sept. 28.

In Mr. Mike Rowe‚Äôs science class, for example, students assembled portions of the skeletal system ahead of this semester‚Äôs studies. The school also made creative use of their learning spaces to ensure proper physical distancing. We're proud of our students and staff for ensuring a safe start to the school year!

#WeAreBCS #BCS #BCSadvantage #BlackhawkPride #WeAreNorthBuncombe #Weaverville #WVL #Asheville #AVL #828isgreat #NCpublicschools

post_text:
In this #NeverStopLearning segment, WLOS ABC 13 speaks with Ms. Clare Rector of Avery's Creek Elementary about being chosen as the Buncombe County Schools Beginning Teacher of the Year, an award available to new teachers.

"I was shocked because I have first-year teacher friends and we all work incredibly hard, and there are so many amazing teachers in Buncombe County. So, for me to have the honor was just incredible," Rector said.

Read our full top story: https://www.buncombeschools.org/cms/One.aspx?portalId=92531&pageId=7980433

post_text:
#BCSreturntolearn: As students briefly returned to North Windy Ridge Intermediate for onboarding this week, they enjoyed the familiarity of their friends and welcoming teachers! Students enjoyed time together in class, during meals, and outside on the school's beautiful green campus. It was a refreshing way to start to the school year and K-8 students now transition to Remote Learning until Sept. 28. Welcome back, students! We've missed you.

post_text:
#BCSreturntolearn: It was an unforgettable first week of school! Students and staff at William W Estes Elementary enjoyed seeing one another during the fall onboarding before returning to Remote Learning until Sept. 28 according to Plan B - Beyond. Students learned about health habits, played outside together, learned new games and subjects, and prepared for another great school year!

Visit ReturnToLearn.BuncombeSchools.org for up-to-date school and safety information.

post_text:
#BCSreturntolearn: The new school year started with fun and reconnection at Glen Arden Elementary School this week. During the Plan B - Beyond onboarding, two groups of students alternated each day from Monday through Thursday, with less than half of students at the school each day. Students tackled engaging projects, made new friends, explored the outdoors, and more! We're proud of our teachers and staff for providing this smooth start to the school year.

#WeAreBCS #BCS #BCSadvantage #Arden #Asheville #AVL #828isgreat #WNC #NCpublicschools #828isgreat #BackToSchool

post_text:
#BCSReturnToLearn: Fairview Elementary School students had a great onboarding week. Both in-person and online, students met their teachers and fellow classmates and found out more about what they can expect for the next few weeks.
Thanks to Fairview staff members for sharing these photos with us.

All students in grades K-8 will be remote learners until September 25. Students in grades 9-12 will have another few days of onboarding before going fully remote on August 28.

Fairview Elementary PTA FES Dads Club

post_text:
#BCSreturntolearn: It was a wonderful week of reconnection for students and teachers! Weaverville Elementary School welcomed students to the classroom this week during the onboarding for Plan B - Beyond. Less than half of the students were in the school each day as two groups alternated Monday-Thursday. It was an opportunity for students make new friends, meet their teachers, learn about COVID-19 prevention, begin their studies, and bring home learning materials for Remote Learning. Here are a few moments from their memorable week together!

Visit ReturnToLearn.BuncombeSchools.org for up-to-date school and safety information.

#BCSReturnToLearn: Black Mountain Elementary and Black Mountain Primary School wrapped up a successful week of on-boarding. Students learned how to navigate the platforms they'll use for remote learning, met their teachers, and also got some time for music and movement breaks.

Today (Friday), all students K-12 are learning remotely. High School students have another four days of A/B onboarding next week.

Black Mountain Schools PTO

post_text:
#BCSreturntolearn: Valley Springs Middle School welcomed the Rams back to the classroom during this week's onboarding for the new school year. Face coverings, social distancing, and frequent hand washing didn't stop students from playing stringed instruments, greeting their friends and teachers, or diving into new subjects!

Students in grades K-8 wrapped up their in-person onboarding today (Thursday) and all students (K-12) will be remote learners on Friday. Grades 9-12 only will have another A/B rotation next Monday-Thursday.

post_text:
The Wildcats at Leicester Elementary School had a fun Thursday full of movement and discovery!

Physical Education teacher Tammy Gregg, who loves to incorporate dance into her classes, led kindergarteners through songs that got them exercising while keeping physically distant. Ms. Gregg was named Dance Teacher of the Year in 2017 by the North Carolina Alliance for Athletics, Health, P.E., Recreation, Dance, and Sport Management.

Students in grades K-8 wrap up their in-person onboarding today (Thursday) and all students (K-12) will be remote learners on Friday. Grades 9-12 only will have another A/B rotation next Monday-Thursday.

#BCSstrong #wearebcs #BCS #BCSadvantage #avltoday #avlstong #community #bcready #BuncombeReady #buncombecounty #NCpublicschools #supportpubliceducation #828isgreat #NorthCarolina

post_text:
#BCSreturntolearn: The friendly staff of T.C. Roberson High School helped students to safely enter the school this morning after a brief temperature screening and health assessment. Assistant Superintendent Joseph T. Hough also greeted them with a smile and ensured that each student received hand sanitizer as they approached the door. It was a smooth start to the day, and an important step in providing a safe learning environment during the two-week (Monday-Thursday) on-boarding for high school students.

Mr. Hough also recently narrated the growing library of 'Safety Series' videos, accessible on our Return to Learn website: https://www.buncombeschools.org/cms/One.aspx?portalId=92531&pageId=3747858

post_text:
#BCSreturntolearn: It‚Äôs wonderful to see students and teachers together again - even for a short time! On Monday morning, students returned to Charles C. Bell Elementary School for their first day of in-person ‚Äúon boarding‚Äù per the Plan B - Beyond schedule. Before joining their classmates in socially distanced classrooms operating at less than 50 percent student capacity, temperatures were taken and parents were asked a series of safety questions.

Following their initial on boarding, all students will transition to Remote Learning until September 28. (During this period, in consultation with local health professionals, we will make a decision regarding the remainder of our schedule this semester.) For more information about Plan B - Beyond, visit ReturnToLearn.BuncombeSchools.org.

#BCSReturntoLearn: Enka District schools started their second day of school on a beautiful Tuesday morning. Teachers met their "B Day" students in-person for the first time and talked about what to expect from their classes.

In order to keep staff and students safe, most schools and buses are operating at less than 50 percent student capacity. Following the #BCS Plan B - Beyond schedule, another group of students will enter these schools for the first time this year on Tuesday. For more information about Plan B - Beyond, visit ReturnToLearn.BuncombeSchools.org.

Our teachers and staff are looking forward to welcoming your children back to school this fall! While this year will certainly look different, our mission and goal remain the same: to provide your child with a rigorous and engaging learning experience.

If your child will be a remote-only learner, your virtual teacher will provide further guidance and expectations for the school year. If your child will be on Plan B Beyond, we have an important checklist to complete each day before you bring your child to the bus stop or drop your child off at school.

‚úÖ Please view 'Return to Learn' Update #5 for more information and a back-to-school checklist.

post_text:
It's been an exciting week as our teachers and support staff headed back to the class to prepare for the new school year. Here's a look around the district as teachers readied their classrooms and experienced valuable professional development.

Students who have opted for Plan B Beyond head back to class in their staggered A/B schedule beginning Monday. If you've opted for remote-only learning this semester, your teacher will provide further instructions.

We are continuing to update ReturnToLearn.BuncombeSchools.org with valuable information, FAQs, Community Resources, childcare options, and training videos. Please check the page often for updates.

Join us as we surprise kindergarten teacher Ms. Clare Rector of Avery's Creek Elementary with some exciting news. She's been selected as the NCCAT-The North Carolina Center for the Advancement of Teaching / BCS 2020-2021 Beginning Teacher of the Year!

"I have always loved working with children and I can‚Äôt imagine doing anything else," Ms Rector wrote on her teacher website. "I am grateful to be a part of such a wonderful community at ACES and am excited to build relationships, grow learners, and create a classroom culture that is inviting for every student."

Congratulations, Ms. Rector!

Seven talented Buncombe graduates received recognition for their performing arts accomplishments and career trajectories this month through the Wortham Center for the Performing Arts / Youth Education Scholarship (Y.E.S.) Emerging Artists Fund program. All 2020 scholarship recipients graduated from a Buncombe County high school this past spring and plan to pursue a career in the performing arts.

2020 Y.E.S. Emerging Artists Fund Scholarship Winners:
‚Ä¢ Anaiya Adwaters (voice/musical theatre) - T.C. Roberson High School
‚Ä¢ Linda Diaz-Aguilar (voice/guitar) - Enka High School
‚Ä¢ Chayse Howard (tuba) - A.C. Reynolds High School
‚Ä¢ Katherine Stevens (voice/musical theatre) - T.C. Roberson High School
‚Ä¢ Julien Swoap (saxophone/theatre) - Martin L. Nesbitt, Jr. Discovery Academy
‚Ä¢ Shelby Taylor (clarinet) - Enka High School
‚Ä¢ Aaron White (trumpet) - T.C. Roberson High School

On a rainy Monday afternoon, Verner Center for Early Learning joined BCS and Buncombe County Government to break ground on an early childhood learning center at Emma Elementary School that will provide high quality early learning experiences for children and their families during the first 2,000 days of childhood. Expected to open in early 2021, the center eventually will serve at least 82 children.

Read the full Top Story:
https://www.buncombeschools.org/cms/One.aspx?portalId=92531&pageId=7934199

post_text:
Buncombe County Schools (#BCS) is expanding access to early childhood education, ensuring kindergarten readiness and preparing students for their tomorrow.

On a rainy Monday afternoon, Verner Center for Early Learning joined BCS and Buncombe County Government to break ground on an early childhood learning center at Emma Elementary that will provide high quality early learning experiences for children and their families during the first 2,000 days of childhood. Expected to open in early 2021, the center eventually will serve at least 82 children.

‚ÄúI want to thank all of you for being champions for early childhood education,‚Äù BCS Superintendent Dr. Tony Baldwin told the small, physically-distanced crowd and those watching remotely on Facebook Live. ‚ÄúThis is a win-win for families and children. Everyone wins with this mission.‚Äù

#WeAreBCS #BCSadvantage #ReturnToLearn #AVLtoday #AVL #Asheville #828isGreat #the828 #PublicSchoolProud

post_text:
We're looking forward to soon having a new Verner early learning center on the campus of Emma Elementary! Stayed tuned for our story and photos from this week's groundbreaking ceremony.

As reported by WLOS ABC 13:
Officials from Buncombe County Schools and Verner Center for Early Learning broke ground Monday on a new early learning center.

So far, the county has invested almost $1 million in the construction and pledged grants of an additional $900,000 over the next two years.

"This is going to expand childcare services for this whole area, the community of Emma and the city of Asheville and be able to provide almost up to 100 new spots for children," said Ashley Parks, the center director for Verner Central.

#WeAreBCS #BCS #BCSadvantage #Verner #Asheville #NCpublicschools #Buncombe #BuncombeCounty Buncombe County Government #828isgreat

Expected to open in early 2021, the center will eventually serve at least 82 children. For more information, visit vernerearlylearning.oVehicles for sale $1500 & under

(Please note: The audio improves after the first couple of minutes.)

#WeAreBCS #BCS #BCSadvantage #Asheville #Buncombe

post_text:
ICYMI: Last summer (2019), these #BCS students made a difference in their community. They spent part of their summer break volunteering at Asheville Humane Society (AHS) to make sure the animals got lots of love and attention!

Danielle Adell, Laurel Seddon, Haley Honeycutt prepped food, played with cats and dogs, cleaned feeding bowls, and helped take pressure off the nonprofit's staff. The experience provided them with real-world leadership training and a chance to help animals in need!

T.C. Roberson High School Valley Springs Middle School North Buncombe Middle School PTO North Buncombe Middle North Windy Ridge North Windy Ridge PTO Joe P. Eblen Intermediate School Leicester Elementary School #WeAreBCS #BCSadvantage #Asheville #AVLtoday #WNC #828isGreat #AshevilleMoms #The828 #Volunteer #StudentLeaders

post_text:
‚ÄúVirtual Learning is so much more than academics,‚Äù said Ms. Tori King, Clyde A Erwin Middle School's 2021 Teacher of the Year. ‚ÄúIt is as fruitful as you make it to be, and I am proud to work in a school that values teaching the whole child. Virtual learning is not figuring out what‚Äôs essential and what‚Äôs not. Virtual learning looks like showing kids they matter. Virtual learning looks like showing kids how to take risks. And yes, sometimes Virtual Learning even looks like a talent show.‚Äù

Read the story at https://buncombeschools.org/cms/One.aspx?portalId=92531&pageId=7908595

post_text:
ICYMI: We put a #GoPro on Piper‚Äôs back so she could say hello to kindergarteners and first-graders at Fairview Elementary School during the last school year! Piper, a golden retriever and certified therapy dog, visited Fairview with her fellow therapy dog, Mika, and their humans, Rebecca Wright and Amy Siniscalchi. They‚Äôre part of Fur Kidz Sake, a local nonprofit that brings trained and certified human-and-dog teams to local schools to help children build reading skills. Students read to the dogs and grow more confident thanks to a nonjudgmental audience.

#BCS #WeAreBCS #BCSadvantage #828isgreat #Asheville #AVL #AVLnews #AVLtoday #AshevilleMoms #PublicSchoolsNC #kidsdeserveit #futuredriven #teachergoals #Golden

Congratulations to graduating North Buncombe High School senior Caleb Buckner, for being one of only six students state-wide to be chosen for the AgYouth Leadership Award!

Caleb told the Weaverville Tribune, ‚ÄúI feel blessed and proud to receive this award and scholarship. I‚Äôm thankful to have teachers, mentors, and family in my life that have taught me how important good leadership skills are and how hard work and dedication pays off.‚Äù

#BlackhawkPride #WeAreBCS #BCS #BCSadvantage #WVL #Weaveville #AVL #Asheville #WNC #NCpublicschools #828isgreat

post_text:
Two Enka High School basketball standouts are making plans to play at the college level for Appalachian State University! Congrats to Hadleigh Dill and Emily Carver for their ongoing success.

As reported by the Asheville Citizen Times:
[Hadleigh] Dill, who averaged 14 points and 8.5 rebounds as a freshman last season, was offered by Appalachian State. Another Enka standout, rising senior Emily Carver, is committed to Appalachian State.

post_text:
Three North Buncombe educators will be recognized for excellence at this year‚Äôs virtual Family, Career and Community Leaders of America (FCCLA) national conference, taking place July 7-9.

"FCCLA has given students the opportunity to reach inside themselves and shine as individuals, as a group, and as a community of students with a passion and goal to become better human beings," said North Buncombe High School family and consumer sciences teacher Ms. Stephanie Griffin.

Griffin and her school's career development coordinator, Ms. Amy White, were two of 13 honorees selected from across the nation for this year's Adviser Mentor Award, explained an FCCLA press release. Additionally, North Buncombe Middle School‚Äôs Ms. Sherry Peek was one of only 58 recipients selected nationally for a 2020 Master Adviser Award.

üóûÔ∏è Read the full Top Story: https://www.buncombeschools.org/cms/One.aspx?portalId=92531&pageId=7827635

post_text:
#ICYMI: Of the more than one million Buncombe County Schools Nutrition meals served so far during the #COVID19 pandemic, more than 44,000 have been delivered directly to families thanks to #BCS Family Resource Center (FRC) volunteers.

Between March 16 and June 5, volunteers took 44,665 meals to families who weren‚Äôt able to reach designated meal sites. During the same period, volunteers delivered 906 supply boxes containing non-perishable food, toiletries and hygiene products, diapers, school supplies, and more.

‚ÄúWords cannot express how grateful and proud I am for the overwhelming response we have seen, both in volunteers and donations,‚Äù said FRC Coordinator Shannon Boyd. ‚ÄúThis community is strong, united, and ready to help each other.‚Äù

‚ùóÔ∏è‚ùóÔ∏è‚ùóÔ∏èThe FRC is continuing service during the summer and needs community volunteers. Anyone interested is asked to contact Ms. Boyd (shannon.boyd@bcsemail.org) for more information.

#BCSstrong #WeAreBCS #BCSadvantage #WNC #BuncombeReady #BCready #BuncombeTogether #the828 #828isGreat #PublicSchoolProud #FeedingBuncombeKids

post_text:
#BCSstrong: School is out for summer, but learning continues for one dual language class at Avery's Creek Elementary. Ms. Dona Pozo recently arranged a Zoom meeting with Spanish author Xuxo Ruiz, who also happens to be a magician! The kids had a great time and got to work on their Spanish skills!

#globaled #duallanguage #gorams #ramfam #rampride #BCS #wearebcs #bcsadavantage #asheville #avl #avlstrong
shared_text:
BCS Digital Learning is with Xuxo Ruiz.
June 24 at 2:06 PM ¬∑

Avery's Creek Elementary Dual Language Educator, Marina Dona Pozo, continues to engage her students throughout the summer months. Today her students met Spanish educator, author, and magician, XuXo Ruiz over Zoom for some math and magic. Xuxo used simple products such as cards, cardboard, and paper to delight students AND teach math. In addition to learning about math and science, students learned about Spain, the country Xuxo lives in and they shared a little about Asheville with him. Just because it is summer doesn't mean the learning stops...especially in Ms. Dona's Avery's Creek Elementary class.

Here is a link to Teaching with Magic https://www.walmart.com/ip/Teaching-with-Magic-9788415058342/806801439?wmlspartner=wlpa&selectedSellerId=0&&adid=22222222228343978432&wl0=&wl1=g&wl2=m&wl3=430710690372&wl4=pla-897385164363&wl5=1015116&wl6=&wl7=&wl8=&wl9=pla&wl10=8175035&wl11=online&wl12=806801439&veh=sem&gclid=Cj0KCQjw0Mb3BRCaARIsAPSNGpUFuV-AA8ODQ3Putn0FGxxb_s3UtpFaWuIlmzd7sNz7DMKJsw3gyRsaAuPtEALw_wcB

post_text:
The Buncombe County Schools Aquatics Center will open for public swim sessions on Monday with safety protocols in place.

The aquatics center, located next to T.C. Roberson High School, will be open Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays from 6-8 a.m. and 11 a.m.-1 p.m. starting June 22. Anyone entering the facility will need to have a temperature check and complete a health screening. For specific #COVID19 safety information and more information about passes and facility rentals, visit https://ymcawnc.org/buncombe-county-schools-aquatics-center.

The 17,380-square-foot #BCS Aquatics Center features a 10-lane, 400,000-gallon, climate-controlled pool. The center also includes 420 spectator seats, a state-of-the-art timing and scoreboard system, UV water filtration, and numerous energy efficient design features.

YMCA of Western North Carolina has partnered with BCS to manage the aquatics center.

#WeAreBCS #BCSadvantage #Swimming #WNC #AVLtoday #the828 #828isGreat #PublicSchoolProud #Asheville

post_text:
The Charles D. Owen High School Warlassies basketball program continues to bring attention and community support as long-time assistant coach Chasity Simpson prepares to take the helm.

As reported by the Valley Echo:
"Two things have remained consistent for the Owen Warlassies basketball team since the start of the 2016-17 campaign: each season has opened with a different head coach at the helm of the program and assistant coach Chasity Simpson joined every one of them on the bench, where she‚Äôs been a fixture as an assistant coach for the past seven years.

While the first trend will continue when the Warlassies tip off their 2020-21 season this winter under their fifth coach in as many seasons, Simpson will be returning to the sideline, but in a lead role."

#IAmAWarhorse #WarhorsePride #WeAreBCS #BCS #BCSadvantage #Athletics #Basketball #WNC #NCpublicscohols #BlackMountain #Asheville #NorthCarolina

We are genuinely proud of each one of you. No matter where your next steps take you, you have shown that you have the determination, courage, and good character to thrive. From this time, Graduates, may we all remember that we can do small things to make a big difference. Congratulations, Class of 2020! post_text:
#BCSstrong: Of the more than one million Buncombe County Schools Nutrition meals served so far during the #COVID19 pandemic, more than 44,000 have been delivered directly to families thanks to #BCS Family Resource Center (FRC) volunteers.

Between March 16 and June 5, volunteers took 44,665 meals to families who weren‚Äôt able to reach designated meal sites. During the same period, volunteers delivered 906 supply boxes containing non-perishable food, toiletries and hygiene products, diapers, school supplies, and more.

‚ÄúWords cannot express how grateful and proud I am for the overwhelming response we have seen, both in volunteers and donations,‚Äù said FRC Coordinator Shannon Boyd. ‚ÄúThis community is strong, united, and ready to help each other.‚Äù

‚ùóÔ∏è‚ùóÔ∏è‚ùóÔ∏èThe FRC is continuing service during the summer and needs community volunteers. Anyone interested is asked to contact Ms. Boyd (shannon.boyd@bcsemail.org) for more information.

#WeAreBCS #BCSadvantage #WNC #BuncombeReady #BCready #BuncombeTogether #the828 #828isGreat #PublicSchoolProud #FeedingBuncombeKids

post_text:
üêé Congratulations to North Buncombe High School's rising senior Clara Hale for being chosen as as this year's North Carolina High School Rodeo Queen by the North Carolina High School Rodeo Association!

As reported by the Weaverville Tribune:
‚ÄúI‚Äôm very grateful and excited to have this opportunity to represent North Carolina and the High School Rodeo Association. I‚Äôm very excited for this year and to interact with all the rodeo association members,‚Äù she said.

Hale is a rising senior at North Buncombe High School, an active member of the Future Farmers of America (FFA), where she is the vice-president and regional secretary and an honor student with CTE honors in Agriculture Cluster. She is also a member of North Point Baptist Youth Group, shows livestock through FFA and 4-H and a current competitor in the Extreme Mustang Makeover Competition.

There's a new head coach leading the charge on the Charles D. Owen High School basketball court! üèÄ

As reported by the Asheville Citizen Times:
After seven years as an assistant coach at Owen High School, Chasity Simpson has been hired as the school's new girls basketball coach.

Simpson is a Owen graduate who played for Bill Rucker and Tim Raines.

"We are very excited for Coach Simpson," Owen athletic director Anthony Lee said. "She has worked very hard for this position and we hope it will be a long lasting tenure."

post_text:
üá∫üá∏ This year marks the 100th anniversary of the passage of the 19th Amendment, which guarantees a women's constitutional right to vote. Clyde A. Erwin High #Classof2020 graduate Allie Jones' essay on the topic took second-place in a local contest and was published by the Mountain Xpress.

"As a citizen of the United States, I feel it is my duty to vote not only for myself, but for women like my great-grandmother who came before me and courageously fought for equality," wrote Jones.

As written by the Mountain Express:
The following essay was a second-place winner in the local Edward Buncombe Chapter of the Daughters of the American Revolution Courageous Beginnings contest, part of the organization‚Äôs celebration of the 100th anniversary of the passage of the 19th Amendment.

post_text:
Happening Tuesday: Carrying the weight of a global pandemic paired with critical social action is exhausting. None of us can fast-forward through this difficult time, but we can make it manageable. Join the conversation about the Mind/Body Connection and Social Justice during the time of #COIVD19NC on Tuesday, June 9th from 1-2:30pm.

Buncombe County Health & Human Services will share community resources to support a healthy mind/body connection and there will be plenty of time for you to ask your questions at the end. Simultaneous Spanish interpretation is available.

Register below or watch live on Facebook: English @buncombegov and Spanish @bchhs.

Buncombe County Government Asheville and Buncombe County School Health Program
#BCReady #buncombeready #BCSstrong #asheville #avlstrong #the828
shared_text:
TUE, JUN 9
Let's Talk COVID - Mind, Body, and Social Justice
text:
Happening Tuesday: Carrying the weight of a global pandemic paired with critical social action is exhausting. None of us can fast-forward through this difficult time, but we can make it manageable. Join the conversation about the Mind/Body Connection and Social Justice during the time of #COIVD19NC on Tuesday, June 9th from 1-2:30pm.

Buncombe County Health & Human Services will share community resources to support a healthy mind/body connection and there will be plenty of time for you to ask your questions at the end. Simultaneous Spanish interpretation is available.

Register below or watch live on Facebook: English @buncombegov and Spanish @bchhs.

Buncombe County Government Asheville and Buncombe County School Health Program
#BCReady #buncombeready #BCSstrong #asheville #avlstrong #the828

TUE, JUN 9
Let's Talk COVID - Mind, Body, and Social Justice

Class of 2020: The Virtual Graduation Ceremony of Clyde A. Erwin High School

Clyde A. Erwin High premiered a video.
June 5 at 11:10 AM ¬∑

You are invited to join Clyde A. Erwin High School in honoring our Class of 2020 Erwin graduates! üéì The virtual graduation is scheduled to premiere at 9 a.m. on the morning of Saturday, June 6th, and can be viewed here on our school website or our official Facebook page.

This is a great achievement for each of these young people. We appreciate that you have made the choice to join us in making this a special day for our seniors to remember.

The faculty and staff of EHS are incredibly proud and honored to have been a part of their growth and look forward to seeing the bright future ahead for these graduates.

üëè We are WARRIOR STRONG! Congratulations, Class of 2020!

A Special Thank You to our sponsors who helped support this special event:
Reems Creek Nursery, Inc.

Class of 2020: The Virtual Graduation Ceremony of Charles D. Owen High School

Charles D. Owen High School premiered a video.
June 5 at 5:57 PM ¬∑

Please join the Charles D. Owen High School community in honoring the Class of 2020! üéì The virtual graduation ceremony is scheduled to premiere at 7 p.m. on Friday, June 5. The ceremony can also be viewed on our school website: CDOHS.BuncombeSchools.org.

Congratulations, Class of 2020! üëè All of us at Owen High are extremely proud of the resilience you have shown throughout your high school career. Our vision for you when you began at Owen High School was to empower you to dream and to prepare you to achieve. We cannot wait to see where you take it from here. Whether you stay in the ‚ÄúThe Valley‚Äù or travel great distances, we hope you will carry with you the lessons you learned and the love of this community.

üêé Always remember that you are a Warhorse!

#BCSGrads: Congratulations to the #Classof2020. Martin L. Nesbitt, Jr. Discovery Academy, Buncombe County Middle College, the Progressive Education Program, and Community High School seniors all graduated this week.

üéìTonight and this weekend, our Virtual Graduations and Diploma Parades continue.

In the coming days, we will share hundreds of pictures and continue to share Virtual Graduations to honor and recognize our students for their accomplishments. It has certainly been a challenging semester, and we look forward to continuing to recognize all of our students as we close the chapter on this school year!

shared_text:
Charles D. Owen High School
June 5 at 8:03 AM ¬∑

Senior Class of 2020,
Today is your day!!! Even though we are living in a world of virtual, embrace and remember this day. You have worked very hard to get to where you are today and you have a lot of people to thank for that. Spend today thanking those that have helped you get to where you are but also reflect on how you got to where you are today! Celebrate today and tomorrow, you have earned it! Congratulations Class if 2020!!!!!!!
Please stayed tuned for a very important instructional video for tomorrow‚Äôs festivities and what you will need to do when you come onto campus. It should be posted around noon today!!!

#BCSgrads ##BCSGrads #Classof2020Strong #BCS #WeAreBCS #BCSAdvantage #Asheville #AVL #828isgreat #WNC #NCpublicschools Asheville-Buncombe Technical Community College, A-B Tech
shared_text:
Buncombe County Middle College
June 4 at 6:02 PM ¬∑ Asheville, NC ¬∑

You are invited to join our Middle College community to honor the Class of 2020 üéì BCMC Graduates! The virtual graduation will premiere at 6pm on Thursday, June 4th. The ceremony can be viewed here on our Facebook page or on our school's website at BCMC.BuncombeSchools.org.

While we certainly wish that we could celebrate with graduates and families in person, our pride in our students is not diminished. We celebrate their accomplishments and respect what each individual has brought to our school.

The faculty and staff of BCMC are honored to have served these students, and we know that they are ready for the future.

From this time, Graduates, may we all remember that we can do small things to make a big difference. Congratulations, Class of 2020! We are so proud of you, we celebrate you, and we look forward to seeing how YOU will make a big difference!

post_text:
#WeAreBCS: We're celebrating our #BCSgrads who showed their courage, adaptability, and perseverance this year! High schools across the Buncombe County Schools district honored seniors with cap and gown pickup events. Schools, businesses, nonprofits, and religious organizations came together to provide gifts, banners, and parades for seniors and their families.

Despite the hardships we're facing during the #COVID19 pandemic, these troubled times have shown us what it means to stand united and work for the benefit of all. Congratulations, seniors, as you step out onto the road and head toward your tomorrow!

A.C. Reynolds High School Buncombe County Early College Buncombe County Middle College Clyde A. Erwin High Charles D. Owen High School Enka High School North Buncombe High School Martin L. Buncombe County Middle College premiered a video.
June 3 at 3:05 PM ¬∑

You are invited to join our Middle College community to honor the Class of 2020 üéì BCMC Graduates! The virtual graduation will premiere at 6pm on Thursday, June 4th. The ceremony can be viewed here on our Facebook page or on our school's website at BCMC.BuncombeSchools.org.

While we certainly wish that we could celebrate with graduates and families in person, our pride in our students is not diminished. We celebrate their accomplishments and respect what each individual has brought to our school.

From this time, Graduates, may we all remember that we can do small things to make a big difference. Congratulations, Class of 2020! We are so proud of you, we celebrate you, and we look forward to seeing how YOU will make a big difference!

post_text:
#WeAreBCS: The North Buncombe Middle School (NBMS) Blackhawk put on some moves to celebrate eighth-graders who are heading to North Buncombe High School next year. NBMS and many other schools held physically-distant parades and other send-off events to celebrate the end of the 2019-2020 school year and the beginning of summer. ‚òÄÔ∏è

"We've had an eighth-grade promotion event for the last 25 years," said NBMS Principal Dr. Jamie Johnson. "It's really important to the kids and their families, and since we couldn't do it face to face, we decided to do it as a drive-thru to celebrate their accomplishments and wish them the best of luck going into high school. With all the changes that have happened this school year, we want to give our students some recognition, closure, and momentum for next year."

#BCS #BCSstrong #BCSadvantage #BCSvirtualdays #WNC #AVL #AVLtoday #Weaverville #PublicSchoolProud #BlackhawkPride

post_text:
#WeAreBCS: The Haw Creek Community Association honored Haw Creek Elementary fifth-graders with a parade led by local law enforcement and fire officials on Saturday. Community members lined the parade route and waved as kids rode by in decorated family vehicles.

‚ÄúI think it made the kids feel important and supported by the community," said Haw Creek Elementary Head Secretary Debbie Whitaker Rowland. "It got the whole neighborhood involved. It was fun to see them."

As school pauses for the summer, our students and families are incredibly grateful for the overwhelming community support that has helped us weather the #COVID19 storm. Together we are #BCSstrong.

#BCS #BCSadvantage #WNC #RocketPride #the828 #828isGreat #AVLtoday #Asheville #PublicSchoolProud

post_text:
#WeAreBCS: As the year comes to a close, our elementary and middle grades schools are celebrating students as they graduate to their next exciting adventure! North Buncombe Elementary School held a parade and banner signing on Friday to celebrate fourth-grade success. These hardworking students will be fifth-graders at North Windy Ridge Intermediate School next year!

From NBES staff: "Words cannot describe how proud we are of these 4th graders and how much we love them. We wish the year could have ended differently, with us celebrating 'normally,' but we can't wish for any better 4th grade students. Congratulations on all your accomplishments this year, and good luck next year at North Windy Ridge! Thank you to all who participated in our 4th grade Parade!" (Photo credits to Mrs. Jen Watkins and Mrs. Rhonda Callison)

#BCS #BCSadvantage #BCSstrong #BCSvirtualdays #publicschoolproud #the828 #828isGreat #AVLtoday #WNC #BlackhawkPride

post_text:
The Asheville Citizen Times reports on Enka High School basketball's Emily Carver as she commits to Appalachian State University ahead of her senior year.

As reported by the Citizen-Times:
"As a junior, Carver averaged 26.8 points, 6.1 rebounds, 2.9 assists and 3 steals a game while being named the Western Mountain Athletic Conference player of the year, the North Carolina Basketball Coaches Association's District 12 player of the year and to the NCBCA all-state second team."

post_text:
#BCSstrong: The #BCS Family Resource Center (FRC) took time on Thursday to thank the dozens of employees who've helped deliver meals and supplies to the most vulnerable families in our community. The FRC now serves over 300 families a day and provides about 900 meals a day (with the help of the Buncombe County Schools Nutrition Dept., of course). The FRC reaches the families who are unable to travel to one of our curbside meal pick-up sites.

"They are teacher assistants, bus drivers, custodians, they have been delivering child nutrition meals for the last 11 weeks to our most vulnerable families," Buncombe County Schools' Shannon Boyd said. "They've shown up every day with a smile on their face."

‚ù§Ô∏èThanks to Brookstone Church for providing lunch as well as Chili's Grill & Bar and Lowe's Home Improvement on Tunnel Rd. for providing gift cards and decorations for the luncheon.

#feedingbuncombekids #community #BCS #WeAreBCS #BCSAdvantage #asheville #avlstrong #bcready #buncombeready #covid19 #coronavirus #OurNCSchoolHeroes #NCLighthouseLeaders

üéì #BCSgrads: During #SeniorSpiritWeek, we‚Äôre celebrating seniors from across the #BCS district. Enka High School faculty and staff lined up to cheer seniors as they rolled up to pick up their caps and gowns, take home a congratulatory yard sign, and sign a senior banner on May 8. As they arrived, seniors and their families passed through an archway of blue and white balloons. They saw teachers waving handmade signs, dancing, and cheering them on.

"Congratulations to our Class of 2020," said EHS Principal Tonya Robinson. "We are so proud of your accomplishments. We understand this last year has not been what you expected, but you made it through and that can not be ignored! You all are unique and will forever remain in our hearts!

EHS will hold a virtual graduation ceremony and a celebratory diploma pick-up on June 6. üéì

üåçWe have a few spots left in our Dual Language/Spanish Immersion Kindergarten program! Apply today for this unique and enriching experience.

Dual Language is a form of bilingual education in which students are taught literacy and content in English and Spanish languages. All six #BCS districts have at least one elementary school with a Dual Language Spanish Immersion program. They are:

‚Ä¢ Avery's Creek Elementary
‚Ä¢ Candler Elementary
‚Ä¢ Glen Arden Elementary
‚Ä¢ North Buncombe Elementary
‚Ä¢ Oakley Elementary
‚Ä¢ W.D. Williams Elementary
‚Ä¢ West Buncombe Elementary

Apply today.

Please reach out to your neighborhood Dual Language school to learn more or log on to immersion.buncombeschools.org.

üéì #BCSgrads: During #SeniorSpiritWeek, we‚Äôre celebrating seniors from across the #BCS district. North Buncombe High School (NBHS) held a cap and gown pickup and banner signing event on May 1. Teachers and staff lined the road and cheered as students and families drove in to pick up their caps and gowns, honor cords, and other materials. The seniors also signed a banner marking their accomplishments.

"Seniors, although we can't all be together, we will celebrate together in spirit!" said NBHS Principal Dr. Samantha Sircey. "It was fun to see you, even from a distance, when you picked up your senior supplies. The smiles on your faces reminded us just how much we miss our end of the year celebrations. NBHS is proud of you! Keep showing that Black Hawk Pride!"

NBHS will hold a virtual graduation ceremony and a celebratory diploma pick-up on June 6. üéì

post_text:
üá∫üá∏ On this Memorial Day, we honor and remember those who gave their lives in service to our nation.

Join our community in attending the virtual Asheville-Buncombe Memorial Day Ceremony at 11 a.m. on May 25, streamed live from Asheville City Hall. ‚ÑπÔ∏è Learn more: https://bit.ly/2SRWD0w

Memorial Day was declared a national holiday by an act of Congress in 1971, though similar U.S. observances began after the Civil War in the 1860s. üóûÔ∏è Learn more about the history of Memorial Day from the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs: https://bit.ly/3gmPtLR

#WeAreBCS: Emma Elementary had a huge teacher parade yesterday! Teachers, School Resource Officers, firefighters, and support staff made signs and decorated their vehicles with balloons. Then they drove along bus routes to say hello to families, who made their own decorations and waved from driveways and bus stops. Many #BCS schools have held similar parades to remind families how much they are missed. Even though #COVID19 has forced us apart, we're #BCSstrong!

post_text:
#BCSstrong: T.C. Roberson High School grads are rallying around a fellow #Ram as we all cope with this new reality of social distancing due to COVID-19.

As WLOS ABC 13's Chris Womack reports, T.C. Grad Ethan Gray, who manages the school's baseball team, has struggled with the cancellation of the baseball season and a complete shift in how we all interact with each other.

'He's so social. Every day of the week he's out volunteering in the community, being on the ball field, just being in this community,' explained his mother, Dana Hartis. 'Then all of sudden that stopped. He had some sad days, some confused days."

üëÄ Watch the full story below!

#RamFam #RamPride #BCSGrads #BCS #wearebcs #bcsadvantage #asheville #avl #avlstrong #ncpublicschools #everyoneiswelcome

post_text:
#BCSstrong: Clyde A. Erwin High celebrated their Seniors on Wednesday. The #Classof2020 picked up their caps and gowns, custom yard signs, and all signed a banner that will be displayed prominently in the school. Teachers also put together gift bags!

Principal Greg Bailey says it was refreshing to see students again, and it was uplifting to celebrate seniors. While it was a positive event, Mr. Bailey says it made the staff realize how much they miss seeing their students in person.

Thanks to the Asheville Citizen Times for capturing these wonderful photos!

post_text:
#WeAreBCS: During Monday's neighborhood teacher parade, Hominy Valley Elementary's Parent Teacher Organization (#PTO) handed out "bags of sunshine" containing highlighters, Post-It notes, Poppy Handcrafted Popcorn, Earthling Coffee + Espresso gift cards, Lemonheads, yellow loofahs, and other "sunshine" themed items.

"We wanted to show teachers how much we appreciate them," said PTO member Meredith Hickerson. "We usually go all out during Teacher Appreciation Week, giving daily gifts and making meals for the staff. But physical distancing in the current situation made that impossible."

So the PTO met in a Zoom call and created a plan to order and assemble the items. The sun cooperated for a bright, beautiful parade on Monday, and the PTO lined up at the school to hand out gifts to grateful teachers.

"Everyone got one," said Hominy Valley Elementary Media Assistant Mary Beth Atherton. "Our PTO is so kind and generous."

#BCS #BCSadvantage #BCSstrong #teachergoals #the828 #828isgreat #AVLtoday #Candler #ProudtobeaJet #PublicSchoolProud #kidsfirst

The Avery's Creek Elementary community recently celebrated their school's 2021 Teacher of the Year, Maureen Wellbery, who's now the Roberson District Teacher of the Year! üíï Families and staff wanted to recognize Ms. Wellbery for her accomplishment and wish her luck as she continues on the process! They surprised her with her very own parade.

Ms. Wellbery tells WLOS ABC 13 that she misses her students and hopes to see them soon. "I love you all. I want you to be safe. I hope that we can resume some normalcy, and I want to see you before you enter third grade," Wellberr said.

Avery's Creek Elementary PTO

post_text:
Emma Elementary's PTO planned a tasty way to recognize the staff and their efforts to support their students and families. On Friday, the staff formed a parade and drove through the parking lot to a food truck, picked up some Poppy Handcrafted Popcorn, and a refreshing Kona Ice.

"It was an opportunity for us to encourage and show appreciation to our staff during this time of virtual learning when they are missing all of their students tremendously," said Principal Carla Shipman. "We are thankful for all they are doing."

*Thanks to Emma Elementary for the photos and information.

#TeacherAppreciation #OurNCSchoolHeroes #NCLighthouseLeaders #teachergoals #excellentemma #erwinproud #BCSstrong #bcs #wearebcs #bcsadvantage #asheville #avl #avlstrong

post_text:
‚ùìWhat word describes your favorite educator? The students at Charles D. Owen High School think their teachers are dedicated, creative, phenomenal, and inspiring! Owen teachers were surprised by this sweet tribute posted online on Friday.

"Our teachers miss their students a lot," said principal Meg Turner. "In thinking about a meaningful way to celebrate Teacher Appreciation Week, it seemed like the students could do it best. When I reached out to students, they were excited to help. When I presented the slide show to the teachers, it was obvious how much it meant to them. I saw big smiles, head nods, and some tears-- a high point for all."

We appreciate all of the wonderful educators who serve the students of Buncombe County Schools.

#OurNCSchoolHeroes #NCLighthouseLeaders #IAmAWarhorse #Warhorses #BCSstrong #BCS #wearebcs #bcsadvantage #ncpublicschools #asheville #avl #ashevillestrong

post_text:
The Dual Language/Spanish Immersion Programs in Buncombe County Schools are challenging and innovative! Here's a look at the Kindergarten class at W.D. Williams Elementary. They're well on their way to becoming bilingual!

Dual Language is a form of bilingual education in which students are taught literacy and content in English and Spanish.
All six #BCS districts have at least one elementary school with a Dual Language Spanish Immersion program. They are:

‚Ä¢ Avery's Creek Elementary
‚Ä¢ Candler Elementary
‚Ä¢ Glen Arden Elementary
‚Ä¢ North Buncombe Elementary
‚Ä¢ Oakley Elementary
‚Ä¢ W.D. Williams Elementary
‚Ä¢ West Buncombe Elementary

üåéIf you are interested in your Kindergarten student enrolling in this unique program, learn more at immersion.buncombeschools.org!

#globaled #kindergarten #wearebcs #bcsadvantage #BCSstrong

post_text:
The BCS Board of Education held a regular meeting on Thursday, May 7, 2020. During this meeting, we highlighted our Buncombe County Schools Nutrition team for their outstanding work in serving the families in our community.

We also recognized our National Board Certified Teachers (NBCTs). They were scheduled to attend this board meeting for our annual celebration, but due to the COVID-19 crisis, we‚Äôve instead created a virtual recognition to honor their achievement. You can view that on our district website: https://www.buncombeschools.org/departments/communications/news_feeds_and_stories/top_stories/national_board_certified_teachers_empower_students

The Superintendent's comments included important clarification on matters including recent state and federal legislation, our school calendar next year, and updates to the grading policy.

For this and more, watch the full meeting or view our BCS Board Briefing: https://buncombeschools.org/cms/One.aspx?portalId=92531&pageId=7707942

#WeAreBCS #BCS #BCSadvantage #BoardOfEducation #WNC #Asheville #AVL #828isgreat

As reported by WLOS ABC 13:
Even though schools are closed, someone still has to take care of the classroom pets. At Nesbitt Discovery Academy, principal Heather Brookshire had to feed the Madagascar hissing cockroaches.

"So, here goes. I hope our students are proud of me for doing this. I'm definitely out of my comfort zone," Brookshire said.

‚ù§Ô∏èToday we celebrate our School Nurses! Our nurses support the health and well-being of 24,000 #BCS students. We appreciate their caring hearts and dedicated spirits! Though our buildings are closed, school nurses are still supporting our families by helping with critical programs such as our emergency daycares and meal pick-up and delivery service. Thank you!

#BCSstrong #schoolhealth #wearebcs #bcsadvantage #828isgreat #the828 #asheville #avl #buncombeready #BCready
shared_text:
Asheville and Buncombe County School Health Program
May 6 at 2:48 PM ¬∑

Today is National School Nurse Day, and we are so thankful for all of our amazing school nurses and the work they do!

School nurses:
‚Ä¢Support students in managing chronic medical conditions
‚Ä¢Collaborate with parents and caregivers
‚Ä¢Coordinate with other healthcare providers
‚Ä¢Train school staff members to keep students safe
‚Ä¢Provide mental health supports for students
‚Ä¢Teach students about health topics including handwashing, dental health, nutrition, and more
‚Ä¢Help with screening students at health fairs and follow up on referrals for vision and dental care

And of course, school nurses also play an important role in our community‚Äôs public health, and have continued to work hard during the Covid pandemic to keep our community safe. If you know a school nurse, tell them thank you today!
#SchoolHealth #SchoolNursing #SchoolNurseDay #PublicHealth

post_text:
On Teacher Appreciation Day (May 5), we're thankful for our award-winning arts teachers and their programs, which help students access their creativity and individuality! In November, Cane Creek Middle School choral director Ms. Kathryn Strickler won the Richard E. Keasler Teacher of the Year Award from the North Carolina Music Educators Association Middle School Section.

üé∂ Her inclusive instruction focuses on each student‚Äôs learning style. She incorporates movement and visual cues that help students learn appropriate techniques and muscle memory. She also encourages the singers to imagine how their individual voices connect with each other.

‚ÄúEvery different type of learner has something to hold on to,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúThey get an experience that will help them remember the material.‚Äù

üóû Read the full story at https://www.buncombeschools.org/cms/one.aspx?portalId=92531&pageId=7250620

BCS Arts #BCS #WeAreBCS #BCSadvantage #AVL #Asheville #WNC #NCpublicschools #NorthCarolina #Education #BCSstrong #TeacherAppreciationDay #TeacherAppreciation

üá∫üá∏üá∫üá∏üá∫üá∏The SRO at Oakley Elementary School is helping students keep an important school tradition alive during the time of #covid19. Deputy Mark Whitted, along with kids who are part of the daycare program at the school, raise the American flag each morning and say the pledge. Deputy Whitted says this is an important tradition to keep as a daily routine.

The Rockets üöÄ of A.C. Reynolds High School are finding creative ways to celebrate teachers during Teacher and Staff Appreciation Week! As teachers cheered on their seniors during Monday's drive-through parade event, principal Doris Sellers secretly drew two names from a hat. She then had their names announced over the speakers and surprised them with flowers (from an appropriate distance) while carrying encouraging hand-made signs.

The signs read, "Teaching is a work of heart," and "Teachers plant the seeds of knowledge that will grow forever."

As we begin Teacher and Staff Appreciation Week, May 4-8, Superintendent Dr. Tony Baldwin and Madam Chair Ann B. Franklin of the BCS Board of Education would like to share a special message with our staff.

‚ÄúThank you for your exceptional dedication and resilience to provide such a strong level of support to your students throughout these challenging times,‚Äù said Dr. Baldwin.

‚ÄúWhen the need arose, you ran right toward it,‚Äù Ms. Franklin said.

üëè Join us in finding creative ways to honor the educators in your school and community during Teacher and Staff Appreciation Week! When you thank them on social media, use the hashtags below and tag @BuncombeSchools on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.

#BCSstrong #BCS #WeAreBCS #BCSadvantage #NCLighthouseLeaders #OurNCschoolheroes

post_text:
During today‚Äôs School Lunch Hero Day, Buncombe County Schools Nutrition staff members at every school received a hand-delivered note! It was a wonderful way to end the week and show appreciation to the men and women who have served more than half a million meals to children since our community was affected by the coronavirus pandemic.

‚ÄúThey are proud of what they are doing and smiled from ear to ear,‚Äù said child nutrition director Ms. Lisa Payne. ‚ÄúI loved that we were able to take the time to see the smiling faces of our dedicated staff.‚Äù

The special notes had a cartoonish ‚Äòhero‚Äô theme with messages like, ‚ÄúHappy School Lunch Hero Day with extra helpings of gratitude,‚Äù and ‚ÄúThank you for being my School Lunch Hero! I salute you!‚Äù

‚ÄúIt was incredible to brighten their day and to let them know that they are truly the heroes,‚Äù Payne added.

It‚Äôs always a good time to take a moment to thank the nutrition staff in your school!

#BCSstrong #SLHD #SchoolLunchHeroDay #WeAreBCS #BCS #BCSadvantage #Asheville #AVL #828isgreat #Buncombe #WNC #ourNCschoolheroes #NCpublicschools

‚ÄºÔ∏èHelp do your part to slow the spread of COVID-19 with Buncombe County‚Äôs new COVID-19 Self-Checker. This automated system provides two valuable community assets:
--Clear guidance for anyone feeling symptomatic;
--Data that will help Buncombe County determine when it‚Äôs safe to begin the first phases of reopening.

‚ÄúIf you‚Äôre experiencing COVID like symptoms, or are concerned about a possible exposure, Self-Checker is the most convenient way for you to get guidance on what your next steps need to be and can connect you to individual level follow-up from healthcare professionals,‚Äù explains Public Health Emergency Preparedness Director Fletcher Tove. ‚ÄúThe information we compile with this tool will also assist Public Health in anticipating surges on our healthcare systems and help coordinate our testing and contact tracing efforts as we work to reopen our community.‚Äù

#buncombeready #BCReady #avlstrong #ashevillestrong #bcs #wearebcs #bcsadvantage #covid19 #coronavirus
Buncombe County Government
Buncombe County Health & Human Services
Asheville and Buncombe County School Health Program

post_text:
#WeAreBCS: WLOS Chief Meteorologist Jason Boyer gave a fun and engaging virtual weather lesson to second-graders at Oakley Elementary School on Monday.

Mr. Boyer taught the kids about high and low pressure, precipitation types, measurement instruments, and severe weather. Students found the presentation exciting and intriguing.

‚ÄúThis is cool,‚Äù one student typed in the chat dialogue. ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt know that!‚Äù

‚ÄúHaving this opportunity to work with a member of our community to co-teach our children about weather was beneficial for all of us,‚Äù said second-grade teacher Sherie Ryan-Bailey. ‚ÄúMr. Boyer showed the kids how energy from the sun affects the Earth and how to measure weather both qualitatively and quantitatively. Those are important second-grade science standards that he presented in a memorable way.‚Äù

Thanks to Mr. Boyer for taking time out of his day to teach #BCS students about his job and the science of weather.

WLOS ABC 13 #BCSstrong #bcsadvantage #bcready #BuncombeReady #828isgreat #the828 #AVLtoday #NCpublicschools #BCSvirtualdays

shared_text:
T.C. Roberson High School
April 30 at 8:49 AM ¬∑

Remember his name.

Today, we honor the sacrifice and memory of Riley Howell, who was truly a Hero Among Us. You can help honor Riley by living with purpose, putting in a hard-day‚Äôs work, taking a walk in nature, or enjoying a home-cooked meal, especially if it was cooked in a cast iron pan.

You can donate to a cause Riley would have loved. You can do a good deed for someone today.

Attached is an online link to the Golden Fleece Tribute that was published last year. For a physical copy of the tribute, write to us and we will send it to you soon.

Also listed is a link to the Riley Howell Foundation. You can help them help others who are in need, too.

Thank you to the entire Howell family for raising a son who was selfless and strong. Your strength in this is a testament to the resolve you so clearly foster daily.

Thank you, Riley, for being a true hero. We miss you fiercely.

https://issuu.com/goldenfleece/docs/vol_41_issue_4_tribute
https://rileyhowellfoundation.org/

#BCSstrong: Thanks to WNCW and ASAP - Appalachian Sustainable Agriculture Project for hosting a conversation with Lisa Payne, our School Nutrition Director. If you missed the broadcast, you can listen via the link below!

‚ù§Ô∏è Please visit response.buncombeschools.org to learn about the myriad of resources available to children in our community during this crisis. Our nutrition program has served over 500,000 meals-which include locally sourced food- since our school buildings closed. We couldn't do it without support from dedicated staff, volunteers, and community partners.

#BCReady #BuncombeReady #BCS #wearebcs #bcsadvantage #feedingbuncombekids #covid19 #coronavirus #avlstrong #asheville #ashevillestrong #community #bettertogether
shared_text:
ASAP - Appalachian Sustainable Agriculture Project
April 27 at 4:15 PM ¬∑

Buncombe County Schools Nutrition is serving nearly 80,000 to-go meals a week‚Äîbreakfast and lunch‚Äîto kids at home, and they're partnering with local farmers to do it. Hear more from Lisa Payne, Child Nutrition Director, in this week's episode of Growing Local.

Growing Local airs every Monday morning on WNCW. Tune in live or listen at asapconnections.org/radio-broadcasts, SoundCloud, or iTunes.

Know someone in need of meals? Anyone up to 18 years old qualifies for the Buncombe County meals. Across North Carolina, you can find sites for student meals at no cost by texting FOODNC to 877-877. In Spanish, text COMIDA to 877-877.

Photo credit: Buncombe County Schools Communication

"Spring is such a special time, especially for #Seniors, with many activities and events that mark the end to life as they've known it for 13 years," said Principal Meg Turner. "We wanted to share our love through a few personalized inspirational quotes to connect with them virtually!"

#BCS appreciates our parents and students for taking on the challenge of Virtual Learning. Don't hesitate to reach out with any questions!

Assistant principal Kasey King of A.C. Reynolds High School shares her experience as an educator and school leader finding solutions during the coronavirus crisis.

"Education has morphed quickly over the past few months to accommodate for the ‚Äòquarantined‚Äô life," she wrote. "While face to face instruction is incredibly valuable and cannot be 100% replicated virtually, Buncombe County Schools was exceptionally prepared to face this challenge."

Read our guest-written Top Story to learn more!

(This story will also be featured in the May issue of The Fairview Town Crier.)

Prepared for the Challenge: An Educator's Perspective
text:
Assistant principal Kasey King of A.C. Reynolds High School shares her experience as an educator and school leader finding solutions during the coronavirus crisis.

"Education has morphed quickly over the past few months to accommodate for the ‚Äòquarantined‚Äô life," she wrote. "While face to face instruction is incredibly valuable and cannot be 100% replicated virtually, Buncombe County Schools was exceptionally prepared to face this challenge."

Read our guest-written Top Story to learn more!

(This story will also be featured in the May issue of The Fairview Town Crier.)

#BCSstrong #WeAreBCS #BCS #BCSadvantage #Asheville #AVL #RocketPride #RPI #RocketPrideInside #828isgreat #NCpublicschools #NCschoolheroes #ourNCschoolheroes #PublicSchoolProud #Coronavirus #COVID19 #COVID_19 #WNC #NorthCarolina A.C. Reynolds Middle School

Prepared for the Challenge: An Educator's Perspective

post_text:
The adventures continue virtually for the Charles D. Owen Middle School Role Playing Club! They recently held a Zoom meeting to connect and bring their characters to life. Teachers Sarah Swann and Buffy Weathington facilitate the club. They say that these virtual club meetings allow students to be creative and build their leadership skills. They also learn valuable teamwork skills as they embark on their quests!
#BCSstrong #BCS #wearebcs #bcsadvantage #warhorses #IAmAWarhorse #warpony #coronavirus #the828 #828isgreat #BCReady #BuncombeReady
shared_text:
Charles D. Owen Middle School
April 21 at 2:14 PM ¬∑

Check out this virtual club that OMS are participating in! The Tabletop Role Playing club was initiated by students. They spend time each week playing interactive games that require them to make live-action decisions for their characters. We are currently on an adventure from the Dungeons and Dragons (D&D) series. Two 7th graders serve as the "Dungeon Masters" and they lead the rest of the players through the storyline. The players choose how they will respond in any given situation, often speaking with the voices of their characters. Dice rolls are used to determine probability of actions and responses. It's a lot of fun and a great way for the kids to spend time together using imagination and acting skills!!
(Some pictures of the actual club, before the stay at home order, are included in this post.)

post_text:
#BCSstrong: Our Homework Hotspot heroes have pushed hard to make sure every student has access to high-speed Internet during #BCS Virtual Days online classes.

Each device allows a student‚Äôs school-issued laptop or iPad to connect to a cell network for Internet access. Homework Hotspots are securely connected to the student's 1:1 device, which is content-filtered on and off campus. After the governor ordered all public schools to close for in-person instruction, Technology Services Field Technicians connected more than 500 additional hotspots for students who lack reliable Internet at home. Over 1,200 are now in use across the district.

#BCSvirtualdays #WeAreBCS #BCSadvantage #AVLtoday #Asheville #828isgreat #Coronavirus #COVID19 #BuncombeReady #BCready #NCpublicschools #ourNCschoolheroes #NCschoolheroes

üé∫ Mr. Greg Love joined the A.C. Reynolds Middle School band as a student back in 1987 and within a year knew he wanted to become a band director one day. By 1998, he achieved his dream and began working with students at Clyde A Erwin Middle and Clyde A. Erwin High schools. Today, he's back with the Rockets and is finding creative ways to encourage young musicians to keep practicing their instruments during BCS Virtual Days! He even wrote, sang, and recorded a silly song to motivate them.

Learn more in this latest #NeverStopLearning feature from WLOS ABC 13 and WMYA MY 40.

post_text:
Young Transportation & Tours has worked with #BCS for many years in helping our schools plan educational and engaging field trips. As the #coronavirus spread across the country in late winter, we made the difficult decision to suspend our spring field trips.

Young Transportation worked tirelessly to secure refunds on dozens of field trips. We want to thank them for their partnership and dedication. Several other vendors have also negotiated field trip refunds on our behalf.

‚ÄºÔ∏èOur school staff continue to communicate and navigate this difficult process and will provide updates to families as they are able to secure further refunds or credits on Spring field trips. We ask for your patience as we navigate this difficult situation. Please direct any questions or concerns to your school.

#BCSstrong #buncombeready #bcready #wearebcs #bcsadvantage #asheville #covid19 #avl #ashevillestrong #letsgotogether
WLOS ABC 13

Buncombe County Schools and Western Carolina University are using their 3D printers to make the much needed protective equipment."

#WeAreBCS #BCS #BCSadvantage #Asheville #AVL #Arden #828isgreat #WNC #NCpublicschools
shared_text:
Glen Arden Elementary School
April 14 at 5:04 PM ¬∑

Glen Arden Elementary school's media specialist, LeeAnn Smith delivered 80 shields to Four Seasons: Hospice and Palliative Care Center. Using the school's 3D printer, she made the visor part of the mask. It takes 2.5 hours to make each one. When that's done, she snaps a clear plastic report cover on the visor and attaches rubber bands and an "O" ring to the back. These face shields are sanitizable and reusable.

Check out the full BuncombeSchools.org Top Story: https://www.facebook.com/BuncombeSchools/posts/3147301365282070

#BCSstrong #WeAreBCS #BCS #RamPride #WeAreTCR #GlenArden #Arden #828isgreat

post_text:
#WeAreBCS: #BCS students are getting creative at home during Virtual Days online classes. Weaverville Primary School students went above and beyond for Mr. Martin's hands-on Color Wheel lesson. They took toys and other household items and arranged them in "wheels" of primary, secondary, and tertiary colors. This important element of Color Theory helps our young artists understand how different colors blend with one another.

BCS Arts #BCSadvantage #BCSarts #BCSstrong #WNC #NorthCarolina #Buncombe #AVL #Asheville #BuncombeCounty #Education #PublicSchoolProud

post_text:
During the April 6-10 spring break, community volunteers stepped up to serve meals to area students alongside Buncombe County Schools Nutrition and other BCS staff. We're proud to call Buncombe County our home knowing that so many who live here are ready to make a difference for their neighbors. As of today, more than 330,000 meals have been served to students who need them since the start of the COVID-19 pandemic.

Special thanks to spring break volunteers provided by departments of the Asheville City Government and Buncombe County Government, Asheville Police Department, Buncombe County Government, Buncombe County Sheriff's Office, our Asheville and Buncombe County School Health Program nurses, and students from UNC Asheville! We couldn't have done it without you.

#BCSstrong #WeAreBCS #BCS #BCSadvantage #Asheville #AVL #828isgreat #NCschoolheroes #Buncombe #BuncombeCounty #NCpublicschools #PublicSchoolProud #WNC #NorthCarolina #COVID19 #Coronavirus #CovidKindness
